name: terminator
content:
terminator noun [C]
(END)
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone or something that terminates (= ends) something: The article described Yeltsin as a terminator of the Soviet system. Certain words and characters are interpreted as commands, separators, or command terminators.
More examplesFewer examplesPolitically, he needs a mediator not a terminator.The semicolon is used as a statement terminator.Terminators absorb signals so that they don't get reflected back into the network and cause data corruption.

terminator noun [C]
(MOON/PLANET)
physics
  specialized the line that separates the dark part of the moon or a planet from the part that is lit up: As the moon rises, the terminator will fall across the crater, and the floor of the crater will be in shadow.
More examplesFewer examplesThe terminator is the dividing line between day and night.We ended off the observing session with the moon, where we spent some time along the terminator.
